file_content.text: Goodbye. May the Force protect you.
You betrayed Zare and helped me defeat her. Why?
She'd have betrayed me, sooner or later. I figured, why wait?
She couldn't be trusted.
I was hoping for a more enlightened perspective, but it's a start.
Working with her was a mistake. At least I had time to correct it.
It was the right thing to do.
It saved your life.
Heat of the moment. I could've just as easily gone with her.
Snap judgment.
I can't tell if you're lying to me... or yourself. Regardless, you have my thanks.
Zare had flash and sizzle, but you're a natural beauty.
[Flirt] You're cuter.
You must learn to look beyond appearances.
Not many can claim they battled a Sith and lived. You're in rare company.
Zare was a pushover. I've had way tougher fights.
I always am.
I'm sure your experience would have been different, had you faced her alone.
You took some hits. Any of them leave a mark?
Are you alright?
My injuries will heal soon enough.
Can't spend bragging rights. I could use a little something for the effort.
How about a reward?
The only reward I can offer is the Jedi Council's gratitude.
What's it gonna take for you to finally warm up to me?
[Flirt.] Rare enough?
"Warm up"? This is Tatooine. It's always warm.
I see now why Zare thought this box was worth killing over. Thank the Force we stopped her.
This is a Sith holocron. It was created centuries ago by a powerful dark lord called Darth Nihilus.
This Darth Nihilus guy famous for anything?
Never heard of him.
He exterminated nearly every Jedi a few centuries ago. It took great effort for us to rebuild.
You're not gonna go all Sithy just by holding it, are you?
Is it safe for you to handle?
It doesn't quite work like that, but your concern is duly noted.
What would something like that fetch on the open market?
Sounds valuable.
It can't be sold! It's terribly dangerous.
I'll ensure this relic remains safely hidden from Zare's allies. The Empire must never access the terrible secrets contained here.
My ship is waiting nearby. I should go. We've saved countless lives today.
Put in a good word about me with your Jedi friends.
All part of the service.
Let's do it again sometime.
Hey, it was fun.
If you were a little more serious-minded, you'd make a fine Jedi.
That and two credits will buy me a drink on Coruscant.
Big deal.
I'm sorry you value wealth over life. I hope you learn better, someday.
You can't leave Tatooine without giving me a goodbye kiss.
I need a kiss.
All this time, you've wanted a display of physical affection? I don't know what to say. Perhaps... if I were not a Jedi....
I thought you'd learned to stop associating with criminals. Why are you here?
You following me, Jedi?
Give me your reason, first.
Vaverone Zare is after something the local crime lord has: a red box.
I have news about your Sith.
Thank you for confiding in me. Whatever Zare wants, she mustn't be allowed to get it.
I'm just an innocent bystander here. Seriously.
[Lie] It's a coincidence.
I doubt we share the same definition of "innocent."
I heard about this palace back at the club. I came hoping to find Vaverone Zare, but it seems I've just missed her.
If you know anything about the Sith's current whereabouts, please tell me.
Rumor is, she's got a hideout under the spaceport.
[Lie] She's in Anchorhead.
I never felt her presence when I was in Anchorhead. Strange.
Zare's headed for the desert, to an underground well called the Lightspring.
I'll tell you everything.
You did the right thing informing me of this.
How should I know?
There must be a reason she sent commandos here....
I don't suppose you'd know anything about my enemy's present whereabouts?
The crime lord she's after is at a cavern in the desert. It's called the Lightspring.
I can hazard a guess.
Zare may already know about that place. There's no time to lose.
I'm going to a desert cavern called the Lightspring. Diago Hixan is there.
Come with me.
The crime lord? Zare is looking for him.
Stay here. When I confront Zare, it will be a horrific battle. You won't want to be around.
May the Force be with us both. Farewell....
Rumor has it she's running things from a shuttle in orbit.
[Lie] She's on a starship.
Odd. She usually stays close to her prey.
I sense I'm running out of time to find Zare. I should go.
Don't take this the wrong way, but I hope our paths never cross again. May the Force be with you....
I saw the Imperial commandos. Are you injured?
It'll take more than the Empire's finest to finish me off.
Don't be silly.
Bravado makes poor armor. You're fortunate to be alive.
I need some Jedi healing, right away.
[Flirt.] Definitely.
Hmmm... I don't see any visible wounds, but better safe than sorry.
There. How do you feel now?
What do you say we do that some more?
[Flirt.] Wow!
There's no need. I can sense you're on the mend.
I could take on another battalion of those commandos.
Ready for action.
There's been enough violence.
That's the best you could do?
The only thing that should be hurting right now is your conscience.
This is private property. Don't you Jedi respect the law?
You just barged in?
I only wish I'd arrived sooner; I could have questioned these men.
A day late and a credit short, Jedi. This battle's long over.
I'm fine, no thanks to you.
Few survive an assault by the Empire's elite. The Force was with you.
They wouldn't surrender. Why don't they ever surrender?
I don't think they hear too good through those helmets.
Maybe you should ask louder?
Please don't make jokes. People have died.
Let's get some fresh air and talk about your feelings.
[Flirt.] You're upset.
That's unnecessary. Although I'm used to conflict, it still affects me.
If they don't fight you, their Sith masters kill them.
They have no choice.
The Empire's brutality is a blight on our galaxy.
Who knows?
The Jedi Masters say fear is what drives us to violence.
I'm disappointed to see you in this place after our last conversation.
I wish this hadn't ended in violence, but it was brave of you to intervene.
It's just what I do.
Your attitude is unexpected--but welcome.
Scum like that has to die of something.
They had it coming.
Every life has value, no matter how wasted it may seem to you.
What can I say? I'm a sucker for a beautiful woman.
[Flirt.] You gave me no choice.
You acted based on your perception of my physical appearance? That... makes no sense.
It was never my intention to cause violence here. It's good you kept out of this fight.
Not the sort of place I expect to meet a Jedi.
What are you doing here?
It's only the second time I've visited an establishment like this. The other time... also ended badly.
No doubt.
The galaxy would be a better place if everyone learned to control their fear and aggression.
Watching you carve them up was the most fun I've had all day.
That was quite a show.
They were bad men, but it's wrong to take pleasure from their deaths.
You might be injured. Better let me check you over.
[Flirt.] Are you hurt?
That won't be necessary. The Force protects me.
My name is Nariel Pridence. It's a pleasure to meet you.
As I told these men, my name is Nariel Pridence. I am a Jedi Knight, here on official business.
I'm looking for Vaverone Zare, an agent of evil and servant of the Sith Empire. Have you heard of her?
I've met a lot of agents of evil, but nobody by that name.
No.
Tall lady, dresses in black, wears a cape? She owes me money.
[Lie] Sure!
I don't think we're talking about the same person.
Is there a reason I should tell you anything?
Maybe, maybe not.
Whoever Zare is, I bet she's not nearly as gorgeous as you.
[Flirt.] She's nobody.
Zare is a being of vast darkness and a grave threat to the galaxy.
I hear she's taken an interest in the local underworld, so I came to observe these criminals and gain information.
Looks like this resource is a dead end.
Sorry it didn't work out.
Yes, it's best I move on.
Criminals don't like being observed--and you stick out like a rancor in a family of Jawas.
You need a new plan.
From now on, I'll keep my distance. I have no desire for further bloodshed.
Stick with me, sweetheart. I'll find this Zare before sundown.
[Flirt.] Let's team up.
That's kind, but I can't place you in harm's way.
Boy, you're dumb.
Fine--but you should avoid places like this from now on. They're not safe.
I sense you're destined for greater things than consorting with common criminals.
Now you see the dangers of consorting with petty criminals. I hope you rethink your life.
I must continue my search for Vaverone Zare. May the Force be with you....
